page.title: 09MISS SMITH
page.content: Miss Smith has lived in Elham since 1904; her house is called King Post and was built in C15, it is so named because of the King Post holding the house together. There were three classes at Elham School, with an age range of 5-14 years. If you passed the scholarship you went to the Grammar School in Canterbury. Travel to Canterbury was by the Elham Valley Railway, which no longer exists. There were no school dinners, you either take your lunch or went home for it. In 1945 there were at least 14 shops in Elham and now there are five. Hog Green, now a housing estate, used to be a green where villagers kept their pigs(hogs). In 1947 the Elham Valley Railway closed down. The King Post used to be the Post Office, until 1944.
